Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a diamond held in hand seems very small but when evaluated and sold, fills the coffers.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ h`Q ivc ilAwˆ hIrw qnk so Cotw ijhw idKweI idMdw hY pr mu`l kIiqAwˆ dmkn rupÎwˆ dmiVAwˆ nwl BMfwr BridAw krdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy br bwDy huMfI lwgq n Bwr kCu; AwgY jwie pweIAq lCmI Apwr jI [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a cheque/draft carried on person has no weight but when cashed at the other end yields much money

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ br bry kpVy dy lV bMnI hoeI huMfI dw kuC BI Bwr nhIˆ lgÎw pRRqIq hoieAw krdw, pr Agy itkwxy qy igAwˆ bÎMq Dn Es dy vtwˆdry ivc imlÎw krdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bit bIj Aiq sUKm srUp hoq; boey sY ibibiD krY ibrKw ibsQwr jI [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as seed of a banyan tree is very small but when sown grows into big tree and spreads all over.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ boVH dw bIj rUp sUrq ivc Aiq sUKm bhuq hI inkVw ijhw huMdw hY pr bIijAwˆ hoieAw ibrKw ibrC bx ky ibibD ibsQwr krY Anyk pRkwr dw twhxIAwˆ twhx Awid, pswrw pswirAw krdw hY, jI hy BweIE[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur bcn scn gurisKn mY; jwnIAY mhwqm gey hI hirduAwr jI [373[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Similar is the significance of the lodging of true Guru's teachings in the hearts of obedient Sikhs of the Guru. This is reckoned only on reaching the divine court of the Lord. (The practitioners of Naam are honoured in His court).  (373)
